job_description:
The ESG risk department in Amsterdam offers off-cycle internship positions to high potential candidates with a strong motivation to work on climate and environmental risk. As an intern you will support the quantification of climate risk for credit risk portfolios.
Job description
You will be working on analyzing climate risk for both physical risk (eg. flood/drought) as well as transition risk (i.e. greenhouse gas emissions) for different credit risk portfolios. The job will among other things comprise the following aspects:
Conducting robust analysis and develop innovative solutions for a range of climate challenges.
Supporting the development of innovative solutions leveraging data and technology.
Use strong communication skills to present outcomes and recommendations.
Prerequisites
Applicants will need to be EU nationals or non-EU students enrolled in an EU university.
Applicants need to be registered as a student with an educational institution for the full duration of the internship.
Applicants need to be available full-time for the full duration of the internship.
Who we are looking for?
Has a university master’s degree with strong mathematical background for example: Computer science, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Ops research, Engineering, Science or other related technical discipline.
Programming experience in SAS or another similar programming language.
Experience in the use of visualization tools is a plus.
Excellent communication skills and ability to write clear reports in English.
Is creative and curious.
Ability to work well under pressure and tight deadlines and willingness to go the extra mile.
What do we offer?
Unique opportunity to learn about climate risk.
Exposure to complex projects requiring cooperation with other departments.
Opportunity to create a network within ING as well as in the wider banking sector.
Competitive allowance and reimbursement of public transport costs.
Your work environment
At ING, we recognize the need, and our responsibility, to take impactful actions to address climate risks and opportunities. That is why in 2021 we set the ambitious goal of aligning our lending portfolio with a net-zero future by 2050 or sooner. To do our part to help the world achieve the goals of the Paris Agreement, ING is focused on driving responsible climate choices within the organization and beyond. As a part of this commitment, ING has established an environmental, social, and governance (ESG) risk department to identify, assess, quantify and measure the risk that need to be reflected in the bank’s risk appetite.

At a glance

Are you interested in advising large corporates and institutions on their capital structure and structuring complex debt financings for them? University education (Bachelor or Master degree);

Can you solve this puzzle?

An ant leaves its anthill in order to forage for food. It moves with the speed of 10cm per second, but it doesn't know where to go, therefore every second it moves randomly 10cm directly north, south, east or west with equal probability.

If the food is located on east-west lines 20cm to the north and 20cm to the south, as well as on north-south lines 20cm to the east and 20cm to the west from the anthill, how long will it take the ant to reach it on average?
What is the average time the ant will reach food if it is located only on a diagonal line passing through (10cm, 0cm) and (0cm, 10cm) points?
Can you write a program that comes up with an estimate of average time to find food for any closed boundary around the anthill? What would be the answer if food is located outside an defined by ( (x – 2.5cm) / 30cm )2 + ( (y – 2.5cm) / 40cm )2 < 1 in coordinate system where the anthill is located at (x = 0cm, y = 0cm)? Provide us with a solution rounded to the nearest integer.

Unique and challenging position for an internal model expert in the on-site banking supervision.
Jij hebt impact
You will have an impact
Do you want your work to have an impact on financial stability and on the banking sector´s ability to support sustainable growth? As an internal model expert at DNB you can do just that in a stimulating and professional environment. Your contribution to the (European) supervisory goals will consist of the participation in impactful assessments of regulatory internal models, with a primary focus on credit risk.
This is what you will be doing as an internal model expert at DNB.
You will conduct inspections of credit risk models according to the advanced internal rating based approach (A-IRB) completely or partially at the banks premises. You will also deliver analyses and advice in the areas of internal models and quantitative credit risk management with a view to supporting DNB’s mandates in banking supervision and financial stability. Finally, you may also be involved in occasional off-site model assessments and benchmark studies as well as the development of analytical tooling and assessment methodology, both within DNB and/or in collaboration with European colleagues. The latter may include the application of advanced data science techniques.
Your main responsibilities as a model expert will include:
Conducting inspections on A-IRB models at different banks as part of a team of experts.
Drawing sharp conclusions, reporting and presenting your findings to the bank’s (senior) management.
Performing through analyses, conducting benchmarking studies and developing analytical tooling and assessment methodology, either at DNB or in international working groups.
Expanding and actively sharing your specialist expertise within DNB and the European Single Supervisory Mechanism (SSM).
Hier doe je dat
This is where you will be working
You will be based at DNB’s premises in Amsterdam. You will be working at the On Site and Banking Expertise Division (OSBE), which conducts on-site inspections and provides expertise in all relevant areas of financial and non-financial risks, employs around 100 professionals with various backgrounds and nationalities and consists of 7 departments. The vacancy in the Internal Model Department (20 staff).
The inspections that you will be involved in are project-based. The project team composition may vary per inspection. Inspections are to a large extent coordinated - and increasingly conducted - on a European rather than a national level. Depending on their seniority, model experts may also expected to assume coordinating roles in the model investigations.
In your role as expert you may be asked to join internal and international working groups on specific parts of the regulation or supervisory manual with regard to A-IRB model aspects. Next to this, you can help by using your programming skills to improve and automate our supervisory inspection tools, which range from custom programs to evaluate internal models to complex machine learning techniques to (for example) summarize documents and reports.
This combination of roles and responsibilities means the job is varied and offers great potential for expanding your knowledge and experience as a quantitative risk professional in terms of both substance and skills. In addition you will have the opportunity to access a wide range of training resources, including dedicated courses on key supervisory processes, data science and soft skills.

And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Senior Consultant Valuation and ESG Impact Modeling
With the impact of climate change and other environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues coming ever more starkly into focus, governments, investors, and businesses are under increasing pressure to take rapid and decisive action.
At EY, we believe sustainability is one of the defining issues of our time, which is transforming many industries as companies reimagine how to create change that’s good for business, society and the planet.
Sustainability is at the heart of our brand. It is at the heart of our strategy, what we value and measure and what we do every day with our clients and within our own business.
We are currently looking to expand our team.
The opportunity
The EY Valuation, Modeling and Economics (VME) team is looking for market facing talented professionals with considerable experience in valuation and ESG modeling (socio-economic, social and environmental measurement and valuation). Professionals who can help clients measure, quantify and in some cases monetise their value to and impact on society, assess the link and correlation to financial value and apply the insights to strategy development, decision making, fact-based stakeholder dialogues and disclosures.
We are looking for colleagues to join us in Amsterdam as their home office. You will be working with corporate clients, governments as well as infrastructure investors and private equity clients.
Your key responsibilities
Our VME professionals provide robust quantitative analysis and insight, while leveraging financial, socio-economic and ESG impact modeling, advanced data science, mathematics and statistical skills. We provide robust, evidenced-based analytics to inform our clients’ strategic and operational decision making around all elements of the capital and sustainability agenda. Often reporting directly to a company’s most senior executives, we enhance our clients’ understanding of costs, benefits, societal value and impact, uncertainties and risks to enable more confident, strategic decisions and judgements around their strategic agenda and capital allocation. We employ tools and techniques to deliver predictive and prescriptive analytics and including the use of economic and ESG impact analysis and financial modeling solutions.
EY Valuation Modeling and Economics is part of EY’s Strategy and Transactions (SaT) practice, that advises clients in all aspects of capital allocation decisions, including Sustainable Strategy, Mergers and Acquisitions, Transaction Diligence and Transaction Integration.
Our teams share a single focus — we want to help clients create actionable strategies which create positive impact for business, society and the planet.
Skills and attributes for success
Pro- activity, accountability, and mission and results- driven people will flourish in this environment. Dealing with competing priorities, understanding how to manage resources, and communicating effectively are key skills. This will have a significant impact on those around you and help promote a positive work ethics. You should be able to demonstrate the ability to think laterally and adapt previous experience and solutions to new projects and be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic team and environment.
To qualify for the role you must have
Minimum of four years of professional consulting experience in economic modeling and ideally also some experience with environmental and social impact measurement and valuation techniques (e.g. input/output modeling, impact statements, life cycle analysis, SROI);
Master’s degree (M.Sc. in a relevant discipline such as economics, econometrics, environmental science or economics, engineering or sustainale finance or related fields) with outstanding academic results;
Understanding of key sustainability issues and trends (carbon, circular economy, social-economic impact) and how they link to business value;
Business case modeling: working on complex projects that require knowledge of business strategy, sustainability strategy and operations.
Ideally, you’ll also have
High motivation and passion for sustainability and a demonstrated capacity to deal with ambiguity and overcome challenges;
Strong technical, quantitative and analytical skills;
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic team and environment;
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and preferably in Dutch, other language skills merited.
What we offer
We offer a developing, socially, and internationally characterized workplace, competitive pay, and the opportunity to influence the development of the business. You will work with some of the world's leading companies - our clients.
Plus, we offer:
Extensive support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech or Sustainability MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that is right for you
EY is a value-driven company where team spirit, respect and integrity are important ke words. In addition to our employees’ commitment and expertise, our shared values create success in the market.
